intro: Porothrinax, commonly known as the grass tree, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Poaceae. These plants are native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. They are characterized by their tall, slender stems and dense, grass-like foliage. Porothrinax species often grow in coastal areas and are adapted to saline environments. Their unique appearance and ecological significance make them an important part of their native ecosystems.
